intro: Lasianthus caudiculatus, commonly known as the slender-stemmed piper, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features a slender, somewhat woody stem with opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy green. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, berry-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
